wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Avey (31 August 1909 – 17 September 1999) was an English professional footballer who played as a forward in the late 1920s and early 1930s. He was born in Poplar, London.

response: *17 September 1999: Fred Avey, 90, had a promising start to his professional career with Fulham in the late 1920s, scoring 28 goals in 62 league games as a forward, but lost his place in the team and was transferred to Torquay United, playing just three league games and dropping out of league football at the age of 24.
